summary: This bill, the "Protecting Federal Employee Rights to Personnel Files Act of 2025," mandates that federal agencies provide current and former employees with copies of their official personnel record files. Current employees must receive these files within seven days of a request. Employees separating after the bill's enactment will receive their files within seven days of separation. Former employees separated before the enactment date can request the files from the Office of Personnel Management, and the director will provide them within 21 days. The bill specifies the format (electronic and physical) and defines "agency."
